name: Social care and support guide
description: If you or someone you know needs help with day-to-day living because of illness or disability, this website explains your options and where you can get support.
headline: Social care and support guide

mainEntityOfPage.headline: Introduction to care and support
mainEntityOfPage.text: A quick guide for people who have care and support needs and their carers
mainEntityOfPage.name: link

mainEntityOfPage.headline: Help from social services and charities
mainEntityOfPage.text: Includes helplines, needs assessments, advocacy and reporting abuse
mainEntityOfPage.name: link

mainEntityOfPage.headline: Care services, equipment and care homes
mainEntityOfPage.text: Includes home adaptations, help at home from a paid carer, staying safe and housing
mainEntityOfPage.name: link

mainEntityOfPage.headline: Money, work and benefits
mainEntityOfPage.text: How to pay for care and support, and where you can get help with costs
mainEntityOfPage.name: link

mainEntityOfPage.headline: Care after a hospital stay
mainEntityOfPage.text: Includes hospital discharge and care and support afterwards
mainEntityOfPage.name: link

mainEntityOfPage.headline: Support and benefits for carers
mainEntityOfPage.text: Includes carer's assessments, support from local councils, respite care and help for young carers
mainEntityOfPage.name: link

mainEntityOfPage.headline: Practical tips if you care for someone
mainEntityOfPage.text: Includes advice on challenging behaviour, moving and lifting people and medicines
mainEntityOfPage.name: link

mainEntityOfPage.headline: Caring for children and young people
mainEntityOfPage.text: Services, support and tips if you care for someone under 21, and moving to adult social services
mainEntityOfPage.name: link

mainEntityOfPage.headline: Making decisions for someone else
mainEntityOfPage.text: Includes powers of attorney and mental capacity
mainEntityOfPage.name: link
